DataElement.preferredDefinition: The frequency of number of times that a person takes dietary supplements.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Person; a human being._Products in capsule, tablet or liquid form that provide essential nutrients, such as a vitamin, an essential mineral, a protein, an herb, or similar nutritional substance. Nutritional supplements do not require FDA approval to be marketed. (NCI)_Use; put into service; make work or employ (something) for a particular purpose or for its inherent or natural purpose._The number of occurrences of something within a given time period. (NCI)

Property.preferredDefinition: Products in capsule, tablet or liquid form that provide essential nutrients, such as a vitamin, an essential mineral, a protein, an herb, or similar nutritional substance. Nutritional supplements do not require FDA approval to be marketed. (NCI):Use; put into service; make work or employ (something) for a particular purpose or for its inherent or natural purpose.:The number of occurrences of something within a given time period. (NCI)

Concepts.definition: Oral preparations containing dietary ingredient(s) intended to supplement the diet.  Dietary ingredients include vitamins, minerals, herbs, amino acids, extracts and metabolites.
A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something.
The number of occurrences of something within a given time period.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Oral preparations containing dietary ingredient(s) intended to supplement the diet.  Dietary ingredients include vitamins, minerals, herbs, amino acids, extracts and metabolites._A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something._The number of occurrences of something within a given time period.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past._For each, generally denoting a ratio._The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day.

Concepts.definition: The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.
For each, generally denoting a ratio.
The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past._For each, generally denoting a ratio._Any period of seven consecutive days.

Concepts.definition: The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.
For each, generally denoting a ratio.
Any period of seven consecutive days.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past._For each, generally denoting a ratio._One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar. It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks.

Concepts.definition: The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.
For each, generally denoting a ratio.
One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar. It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks.
